name: Project Cost Control Specialist
description:
Project Control Specialist (PCS) will be allocated medium and/or multi projects and functionally reports to the Regional Projects Controls Manager, for the region within which he/she operates, and agrees day-to-day activities with the COM or Project Manager.
The PCS is responsible for supervising and coordinating activities on allocated projects, as well as the legitimacy of the work assignments for allocated projects & personnel. The PCS will ensure corporate governance, procedure compliance and will provide technical leadership to GPC personnel allocated to the PCS’s projects. The PCS will be expected to stand in for the SPC during periods of absence.

Direct Responsibility:
• Accountable for accuracy & timely delivery of all project & management estimates, reports & forecasts for costs & schedules on allocated projects including quarterly exception report
• Ensures the accuracy of earned value data on allocated projects
• Actively participates in project review meetings & provides clear, accurate project assessments & gives proactive advice to drive successful project completion
• Responsible for project control procedure compliance & standards on allocated projects
• Performs project cost risk analysis for developing project contingency budgets and maintains run down curves for continued project cost risk assessment
• Manage the receivables & payables balance on allocated projects, responsible for accuracy of invoices
• Assist PCL & SPC as required
• Stand in for Senior Project Control Specialist during periods of absence
• Prepares the final project cost/schedule reports & provides the data recovery for the company historical database

Skill Requirements:
• MS Office, SAP
• System development - estimating, tracking and control
• Finance & cash flow – concepts, processes, planned, actual, forecast
• Communication skills – oral, written, presentation
• Good knowledge of estimating, tracking and control
• Good knowledge of contracts
• Negotiation & conflict management skills
• Cost risk analysis/contingency management
• Total Quality Management concepts
• Proactive, helpful, constructive, integrity & open
Qualifications:
• Demonstrable leadership experience and ability to work in a team
• 2 years related experience
• Professional qualification in engineering or project management or finance.
